title: Longest Repeating Character Replacement
description: Given an integer k and a string s, you can select any character in the string and change it to any other uppercase English character. You can perform this operation up to k times. Return the length of the longest substring that contains the same letter after performing these changes.
aim: Demonstrate variable-size sliding window with character frequency tracking; expand when replacements â‰¤ k and contract when replacements > k to find longest substring with same character.

examples.explanation: We can change the 'B' at index 0 and 3 (0-based indexing) to 'A'. The new string is "AAAAAABBBAAA". The substring "AAAAAA" is the longest substring with the same letter, with length 6.
Change the 'A' at index 2 to 'B'. The new string becomes "AABBBBA". The substring "BBBB" has the maximum length = 4.

steps.jarvisMessage: Welcome! We'll use a sliding window to find the longest substring where we can replace at most k=1 character to make all characters the same. We'll track character frequencies and the most frequent character count.
steps.codeBotMessage: We'll expand the window when (windowSize - maxRepeatLetterCount) â‰¤ k and contract when it exceeds k. This ensures we stay within our replacement limit.
